frameDefinitions: A Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an Issue.
An Agent has an Attribute which can take different Values, and the Agent selects and then begins to use some Value for that Attribute.
A Topical_entity has properties which are affected by the existence and association of an Entity.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal.

A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
frameExamples: In interviews , it seems like everyone is completely <t>against</t> this expenditure .
They scoff at their opponents and <t>assume</t> an air of superior knowledge
By the 1920s a characteristic book <t>had</t> black and white photographic illustrations only .
The fraud was <t>extradited</t> from Venezuela to the US.
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.
An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
The <fen>Agent</fen> selects a <fen>Value</fen> for his/her <fen>Attribute</fen> and begins to use it.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen> can take on several <fen>Value</fen>s, selected by the <fen>Agent</fen> .
The <fen>Value</fen>, chosen and made effective by the <fen>Agent</fen>, specifies the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The time period when the <fen>Agent</fen> selects and begins to put into effect the <fen>Value</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> has the <fen>Attribute</fen> which can take different <fen>Value</fen>.
Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist and be associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The entity under discussion, whose states and properties are impacted by its association with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists and is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>
The place where the <fen>Entity</fen> is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> act on behalf of the <fen>Current_jurisdiction</fen>, giving up the <fen>Suspect</fen> to the Crime_jurisdiction.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the <fen>Suspect</fen> starts off in.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is sent.
The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.
The time at which  the <fen>Suspect</fen> is moved.
The location where the extradition occurs.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Last year</fex> she opposed the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill.
<fex>Some organizations, like the Sierra Club</fex>, have adopted a position of neutrality on US immigration policies.
The Council of Constance (1414-18) adopted conciliarism <fex>as a stance</fex>, hoping that it would permit the election of a pope acceptable to both Catholic factions.
He crammed his cap back again into his pocket and re-entered the office, assuming <fex>an air of absentmindedness</fex>.
<fex>On January 1, 2001</fex>, our nation will adopt the US dollar as our official currency.
<fex>John</fex> attempted to climb Mt. Everest.
John attempted <fex>to climb Mt. Everest</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he attempted to put the wig on.
<fex>French officials</fex> extradited him back to Canada.
Jones was extradited <fex>from Mexico</fex> last Thursday to face criminal charges in the United States.
It was the third time a neo-Nazi was extradited from Denmark <fex>to Germany</fex>.
A hearing on whether or not to extradite <fex>Johnson</fex> to Isreal will be held tomorrow.
<fex>In Europe</fex> they extradite more freely than in North America.
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
